User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account in the system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

createdDateTime.description: Date and time the user account was created.

UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's public profile information, linked to a User account.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile entity. Matches the user's auth UID.

Post.title: Post
Post.description: Represents a post in the content feed.

id.description: Unique identifier for the post entity.

userId.description: Reference to the UserProfile entity of the author.

caption.description: Description or caption for the post.

createdAt.description: Date and time the post was created.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project in the opportunity marketplace.

id.description: Unique identifier for the project entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the project.

ownerId.description: Reference to the UserProfile entity of the project creator.

createdAt.description: Date and time the project was created.

StudioProfile.title: StudioProfile
StudioProfile.description: Represents the profile information for a studio.

id.description: Unique identifier for the studio profile entity.

location.description: Location of the studio, including address and coordinates.

address.description: The full address of the studio.

latitude.description: The latitude of the studio location.

longitude.description: The longitude of the studio location.

photos.description: List of URLs of studio photos.

userId.description: The ID of the user who posted the status.

mediaUrl.description: URL of the image/video, or the link for link-type statuses.

mediaType.description: The type of media for the status.

text.description: Optional text caption or the content for a text-only status.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the status was created.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp when the status will auto-expire (24 hours after creation).

viewers.description: List of user IDs who have viewed the status.

Short.title: Short
Short.description: Represents a short video clip, similar to TikTok or Instagram Reels.

id.description: Unique identifier for the short video.

userId.description: ID of the user who uploaded the short.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the short was created.

definition.description: Stores basic, private user account information, separate from public profiles.
Stores public user profile information. The document ID matches the user's auth UID.
Stores individual status updates for a user. Allows for a collection group query on 'statuses'.
A top-level collection for all user posts to allow for an aggregated feed.
A top-level collection for all projects.
A top-level collection for all studio profiles.
A top-level collection for all short videos, enabling an aggregated feed.

firestore.reasoning: This simplified structure directly matches the user's confirmed list of collections: users, user_profiles, posts, projects, and studio_profiles. It uses a flat architecture for scalable queries, especially for the main post feed. User data is split between private 'users' and public 'user_profiles' for security. Statuses are a subcollection under user_profiles to enable efficient querying and collection group scans. Shorts are in their own top-level collection for a global feed.
